Shortcodes Showcase

This page demonstrates all available shortcodes in Chiron. Use this as a reference and testing ground.

[callout type="info" title="What are Shortcodes?"]
Shortcodes are WordPress-compatible syntax elements that let you add rich components to your markdown content. They're processed before markdown parsing, so you can use markdown inside them!
[/callout]

Tabs

Perfect for code examples, installation guides, or platform-specific instructions.

[tabs]
[tab title="JavaScript"]

// JavaScript example
const greeting = 'Hello, World!';
console.log(greeting);

[/tab]
[tab title="Python"]

# Python example
greeting = 'Hello, World!'
print(greeting)

[/tab]
[tab title="Ruby"]

# Ruby example
greeting = 'Hello, World!'
puts greeting

[/tab]
[/tabs]

Accordion

Great for FAQs, detailed explanations, or collapsible content.

[accordion title="What is Chiron?"]
Chiron is a modern static site generator designed specifically for documentation. It combines the simplicity of markdown with powerful features like shortcodes, i18n support, and advanced theming.
[/accordion]

[accordion title="Why use shortcodes?" open="true"]
Shortcodes provide a WordPress-compatible way to add rich components without writing HTML. They're:

  • Easy to use
  • Secure by default
  • Extensible
  • Familiar to millions of users
    [/accordion]

[accordion title="Can I create custom shortcodes?"]
Yes! You can register custom shortcodes programmatically. See the documentation for details.
[/accordion]

Buttons

Call-to-action buttons with different styles.

[button url="/docs" style="primary"]Primary Button[/button]
[button url="/examples" style="secondary"]Secondary Button[/button]
[button url="/api" style="success"]Success Button[/button]
[button url="/download" style="danger"]Danger Button[/button]
[button url="https://github.com" style="outline" external="true"]External Link[/button]

Callouts

Highlight important information with different severity levels.

[callout type="info"]
Information: This is a standard informational callout with markdown support.
[/callout]

[callout type="success" title="Success!"]
Your build completed successfully in 0.12 seconds.
[/callout]

[callout type="warning" title="Warning"]
This feature is experimental and may change in future versions.
[/callout]

[callout type="danger" title="Breaking Change"]
Version 2.0 introduces breaking changes. Please review the migration guide before upgrading.
[/callout]

[callout type="tip"]
üí° Pro Tip: Use callouts to draw attention to important information without breaking the flow of your content.
[/callout]

Badges

Inline badges for status, versions, or categories.

API Reference [badge type="success"]v2.0[/badge]

This feature is [badge type="warning"]Experimental[/badge] and requires [badge type="info"]Node 18+[/badge].

Status: [badge type="success"]Stable[/badge] | [badge type="danger"]Deprecated[/badge] | [badge type="primary"]New[/badge]

Info Boxes

Styled information boxes with icons.

[info-box type="tip" icon="üí°" title="Pro Tip"]
Combine shortcodes to create rich, interactive content. For example, use grids with feature cards for a professional feature showcase.
[/info-box]

[info-box type="note" icon="üìù"]
Note: All shortcodes support markdown, so you can use formatting, links, lists, and even code blocks inside them.
[/info-box]

[info-box type="warning" icon="‚ö†Ô∏è" title="Important"]
Always validate user input when creating custom shortcodes to prevent security vulnerabilities.
[/info-box]

Installation

Choose your package manager:

[tabs]
[tab title="npm"]

npm install chiron

[/tab]
[tab title="yarn"]

yarn add chiron

[/tab]
[tab title="pnpm"]

pnpm add chiron

[/tab]
[/tabs]
[/grid-item]
[grid-item]

Quick Start

[accordion title="Step 1: Initialize"]

chiron init my-docs
cd my-docs

[/accordion]

[accordion title="Step 2: Configure"]
Edit chiron.config.yaml with your settings.
[/accordion]

[accordion title="Step 3: Build"]

npm run build

[/accordion]
[/grid-item]
[/grid]

[info-box type="tip" icon="üöÄ"]
Ready to launch? Check out our deployment guide for hosting options.
[/info-box]

Nesting Example

Shortcodes support nesting up to 5 levels deep.

[callout type="info"]

Nested Content

[tabs]
[tab title="Features"]
[grid cols="2"]
[grid-item]
[feature-card icon="‚ö°" title="Fast"]
Blazing fast builds
[/feature-card]
[/grid-item]
[grid-item]
[feature-card icon="üîí" title="Secure"]
Enterprise security
[/feature-card]
[/grid-item]
[/grid]
[/tab]
[tab title="Benefits"]

  • Easy to use
  • WordPress-compatible
  • Extensible
    [/tab]
    [/tabs]
    [/callout]

Migration from Old Syntax

The old :::tabs syntax is still supported for backward compatibility:

This still works!

We recommend migrating to the new [tabs] syntax for better compatibility.

[callout type="warning" title="Deprecation Notice"]
The :::tabs syntax will be deprecated in version 3.0. Please migrate to [tabs] shortcode syntax.
[/callout]

Performance Tips

[info-box type="tip" icon="‚ö°"]
Optimization Tips:

  1. Shortcodes are only processed if detected in content
  2. Build uses parallel processing for maximum speed
  3. Template caching reduces build times
  4. Limit nesting depth to 3 levels for best performance
    [/info-box]

Security

[callout type="success" title="Built-in Security"]
All shortcodes include:

  • XSS prevention through HTML escaping
  • DoS protection with nesting limits (max 5 levels)
  • Input validation for all attributes
  • Safe defaults for all parameters
    [/callout]

Advanced Code Blocks

Enhanced code blocks with titles, filenames, and line numbers.

[code-block lang="javascript" filename="server.js" title="Express Server"]
const express = require('express');
const app = express();

app.get('/', (req, res) => {
res.send('Hello World!');
});

app.listen(3000, () => {
console.log('Server running on port 3000');
});
[/code-block]

[code-block lang="python" lines="true"]
def fibonacci(n):
if n <= 1:
return n
return fibonacci(n-1) + fibonacci(n-2)

print(fibonacci(10))
[/code-block]

Forms

Create interactive forms for contact, feedback, or data collection.

[callout type="info"]
Note: Forms require backend integration. The examples below show the markup only.
[/callout]

[form action="/api/contact" method="POST" id="contact-form"]

[form-field type="text" name="name" label="Your Name" placeholder="John Doe" required="true"][/form-field]

[form-field type="email" name="email" label="Email Address" placeholder="john@example.com" required="true"][/form-field]

[form-field type="textarea" name="message" label="Message" placeholder="Your message here..."][/form-field]

[button url="#" style="primary"]Send Message[/button]

[/form]

Real-World Example: Documentation Page

Combining multiple shortcodes for a complete documentation page.

[hero title="API Documentation" subtitle="RESTful API v2.0" align="center"]
Complete reference for our REST API with examples in multiple languages.
[/hero]

[callout type="info" title="Getting Started"]
Before using the API, you'll need an API key. Sign up here to get started.
[/callout]

Authentication

[tabs]
[tab title="cURL"]
[code-block lang="bash" filename="auth.sh"]
curl -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY"
https://api.example.com/v2/users
[/code-block]
[/tab]
[tab title="JavaScript"]
[code-block lang="javascript" filename="auth.js"]
fetch('https://api.example.com/v2/users', {
headers: {
'Authorization': 'Bearer YOUR_API_KEY'
}
})
.then(res => res.json())
.then(data => console.log(data));
[/code-block]
[/tab]
[tab title="Python"]
[code-block lang="python" filename="auth.py"]
import requests

headers = {'Authorization': 'Bearer YOUR_API_KEY'}
response = requests.get('https://api.example.com/v2/users', headers=headers)
print(response.json())
[/code-block]
[/tab]
[/tabs]

Endpoints

[table sortable="true"]

Method Endpoint Description
GET /users List all users
GET /users/:id Get user by ID
POST /users Create new user
PUT /users/:id Update user
DELETE /users/:id Delete user
[/table]

Response Codes

[grid cols="2"]
[grid-item]
[info-box type="tip" icon="‚úÖ" title="Success Codes"]

  • 200 - OK
  • 201 - Created
  • 204 - No Content
    [/info-box]
    [/grid-item]
    [grid-item]
    [info-box type="warning" icon="‚ö†Ô∏è" title="Error Codes"]
  • 400 - Bad Request
  • 401 - Unauthorized
  • 404 - Not Found
  • 500 - Server Error
    [/info-box]
    [/grid-item]
    [/grid]

FAQ

[accordion title="What is rate limiting?"]
Rate limiting restricts the number of API calls you can make per hour. Free tier: 100 requests/hour. Pro tier: 10,000 requests/hour.
[/accordion]

[accordion title="How do I upgrade my plan?"]
Visit your dashboard and click "Upgrade Plan" to see available options.
[/accordion]

[accordion title="Is there a sandbox environment?"]
Yes! Use https://sandbox.api.example.com for testing without affecting production data.
[/accordion]

[blockquote author="Chiron Team"]
Build better documentation, faster.
[/blockquote]
